I want to say to you sir, if you proscribe in this committee's investigation, you're going to prescribe that one, that the witnesses are going and come before that committee over there and they're going to say, “Wait a minute, under the U.S. Supreme Court's decision, you can't make me testify about my association with the people that I'm -- have duty to conspired with to get this channel for television unlawfully.”
Now, what value?

turn.speaker: hugo_l_black
turn.label: Justice Hugo L. Black
turn.text: Well, it might be of -- because -- not be a problem there, might they not, in any legislation as to how I'm quoted.

turn.speaker: mark_r_hawes
turn.label: Mr. Mark R. Hawes
turn.text: The value of it is (Voice Overlap) --

turn.speaker: hugo_l_black
turn.label: Justice Hugo L. Black
turn.text: – specifically, certain specific knowledge about certain specific individuals doing something which many people thinks wrong would -- how useful that would be in connection with the present legislation?

turn.speaker: mark_r_hawes
turn.label: Mr. Mark R. Hawes
turn.text: Well, you see Mr. Justice Black, if I may be perfectly frank, the difficulty with your question is that it encompasses your belief that we are trying to do something other than operate legitimately in the legislature in Florida.

turn.speaker: hugo_l_black
turn.label: Justice Hugo L. Black
turn.text: Well, not necessarily at all.

turn.speaker: mark_r_hawes
turn.label: Mr. Mark R. Hawes
turn.text: And I can't answer that question.

turn.speaker: hugo_l_black
turn.label: Justice Hugo L. Black
turn.text: It doesn't necessarily to be that at all.
Frequently people legitimately, they want to do things but maybe they are forbidden to do by the Constitution.
That doesn't mean that --

turn.speaker: mark_r_hawes
turn.label: Mr. Mark R. Hawes
turn.text: I want to say this to you Mr. Justice Black.
Any information had been recognized by this Court and all the other courts for years, any information vying upon matters as subject, the proper subject to a proper legislation.

Any such information this Court has always said the committees of the Congress over here entitled to have to enlighten them and whatever agreed it might be competent to enlighten them and (Inaudible) the past legislation --

turn.speaker: hugo_l_black
turn.label: Justice Hugo L. Black
turn.text: Enlighten him in the passage of legislation within their comity --

turn.speaker: mark_r_hawes
turn.label: Mr. Mark R. Hawes
turn.text: Yes sir.

turn.speaker: hugo_l_black
turn.label: Justice Hugo L. Black
turn.text: -- or court, that's right.

turn.speaker: mark_r_hawes
turn.label: Mr. Mark R. Hawes
turn.text: Yes sir.

turn.speaker: hugo_l_black
turn.label: Justice Hugo L. Black
turn.text: But the question is -- does that -- the question I'm asking was based on the criminals could possibly [Inaudible] and maybe have been said in some of our cases, the question of how important that legislative purpose is as compared with the freedom of association guaranteed by the Constitution.

turn.speaker: mark_r_hawes
turn.label: Mr. Mark R. Hawes
turn.text: You've answered that question in the Uphaus case if Your Honor please.
You've said, communist investigation in the state is an overriding stated --

turn.speaker: hugo_l_black
turn.label: Justice Hugo L. Black
turn.text: You said (Voice Overlap) --

turn.speaker: mark_r_hawes
turn.label: Mr. Mark R. Hawes
turn.text: -- puts it to rest --

turn.speaker: hugo_l_black
turn.label: Justice Hugo L. Black
turn.text: Was that said abstractly?
Or I -- or rather -- well, I didn't agree with that opinion.

turn.speaker: mark_r_hawes
turn.label: Mr. Mark R. Hawes
turn.text: I understand that Your Honor.

turn.speaker: hugo_l_black
turn.label: Justice Hugo L. Black
turn.text: I said – [Inaudible] abstractly.

turn.speaker: mark_r_hawes
turn.label: Mr. Mark R. Hawes
turn.text: That's --

turn.speaker: hugo_l_black
turn.label: Justice Hugo L. Black
turn.text: I didn't think it was made in the abstract rule that any time there was a legislature who wanted any information at all about communism, all other rights would be subordinated to it.
I thought that that case went more largely on the basis that you had to consider if necessity, overriding the certainty of the state.

turn.speaker: mark_r_hawes
turn.label: Mr. Mark R. Hawes
turn.text: Yes sir.
But Your Honor, this Court as a composite group held in that case that the motive of the investigators could not be considered.

turn.speaker: hugo_l_black
turn.label: Justice Hugo L. Black
turn.text: Well, that wasn't at all (Voice Overlap) --

turn.speaker: mark_r_hawes
turn.label: Mr. Mark R. Hawes
turn.text: Now, that was immaterial.

turn.speaker: hugo_l_black
turn.label: Justice Hugo L. Black
turn.text: I was not talking about motives and I didn't intend to.
I simply wanted to ask, what purpose in your mind -- how much assistance was given to the legislature if it succeeded in getting this man, give these 14 names that he brought in his record.
How much could one reasonably say that would happen in the passage of the law?

turn.speaker: mark_r_hawes
turn.label: Mr. Mark R. Hawes
turn.text: Well, if Your Honor please --

turn.speaker: hugo_l_black
turn.label: Justice Hugo L. Black
turn.text: I suppose it did -- I am [Inaudible] in the passage of it.

turn.speaker: mark_r_hawes
turn.label: Mr. Mark R. Hawes
turn.text: That wouldn't be limited in my judgment to the imagination of the members of the legislature and what they wanted to affect by way of legislation.

Let me say this to you sir that in the instance of the White Citizens Council and the Ku Klux Klan that we've investigated, we examined our statutes very carefully and we found that we had criminal statutes on the books to -- that undoubtedly covered any illegal activities or any violent activities of those organizations were engaged in.
Now, you've got other situation --

turn.speaker: hugo_l_black
turn.label: Justice Hugo L. Black
turn.text: Would it not cover it with reference to other organizations?

turn.speaker: mark_r_hawes
turn.label: Mr. Mark R. Hawes
turn.text: No sir, because the Ku Klux Klan and the White Citizens Council does not operate like the Communist Party operation, Mr. Justice Black.
They don't operate by direction.
They don't go out and put on their robes and get out and then grab up a fellow and take him out and flog him, if you please.
Now, the NAACP in its national convention tells you something about how they operate and we read that in page 7 of the appendix here.
They operate through organizations and the more you know about an operation of that type, the more your imagination will help you to put together legislation that might be useful in combating it.

turn.speaker: earl_warren
turn.label: Chief Justice Earl Warren
turn.text: Did your committee asked for and received the membership list of the Ku Klux Klan?

turn.speaker: mark_r_hawes
turn.label: Mr. Mark R. Hawes
turn.text: They don't have one, but we identify the members of the Ku Klux Klan Mr. Chief Justice and we had many members up there testifying for the Committee, yes sir.

turn.speaker: earl_warren
turn.label: Chief Justice Earl Warren
turn.text: Did you ask for and received the membership of White Council's?

turn.speaker: mark_r_hawes
turn.label: Mr. Mark R. Hawes
turn.text: We did in fact get a membership list to the White Citizens Council, Seabord White Citizens Council which was John Kasper's organization in Florida and Miami, headed by a man named David Hackett.

turn.speaker: earl_warren
turn.label: Chief Justice Earl Warren
turn.text: Did you get it freely – did you get the list through the custodian?

turn.speaker: mark_r_hawes
turn.label: Mr. Mark R. Hawes
turn.text: Yes sir.
Hackett, brought it right into the hearing room, turning over to us.

turn.speaker: hugo_l_black
turn.label: Justice Hugo L. Black
turn.text: Was that the only one there?
Is that the only Citizens Council in the state that --

turn.speaker: mark_r_hawes
turn.label: Mr. Mark R. Hawes
turn.text: The only one that I'm aware of and this was -- John remained a member of -- John Kasper, I think a very respectful character.
He was messing around down in your State of Alabama down there in election.
Just before he came down there and we served a subpoena on him.

He had only one chapter in Florida at that time and it was in Miami and Hackett was his man down there and he brought the membership list right on up to the Capitol in Dallas and turned it over to us, subject to our subpoenas.

turn.speaker: hugo_l_black
turn.label: Justice Hugo L. Black
turn.text: Did you have any competitors of the Citizens Council at that time?

turn.speaker: mark_r_hawes
turn.label: Mr. Mark R. Hawes
turn.text: None -- I'm sure he does have.

I'm sure that he does have but they have not taken any -- and there's no evidence that they have taken any violent position in the State of Florida as I read in the press, they have in other states Mr. Justice Black.

turn.speaker: arthur_j_goldberg
turn.label: Justice Arthur J. Goldberg
turn.text: Suppose that he refers to the [Inaudible]

turn.speaker: mark_r_hawes
turn.label: Mr. Mark R. Hawes
turn.text: Yes sir, frankly located.

turn.speaker: arthur_j_goldberg
turn.label: Justice Arthur J. Goldberg
turn.text: [Inaudible]

turn.speaker: mark_r_hawes
turn.label: Mr. Mark R. Hawes
turn.text: Yes sir.

turn.speaker: arthur_j_goldberg
